title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (Standing alone) In a little state with a small population, I would so order it, that, though there were individuals with the abilities of ten or a hundred men, there should be no employment of them;

passages.zh: 使有什伯之器而不用；使民重死而不遠徙。
passages.en: I would make the people, while looking on death as a grievous thing, yet not remove elsewhere (to avoid it).

passages.zh: 雖有舟輿，無所乘之，雖有甲兵，無所陳之。
passages.en: Though they had boats and carriages, they should have no occasion to ride in them; though they had buff coats and sharp weapons, they should have no occasion to don or use them.

passages.zh: 使民復結繩而用之，甘其食，美其服，安其居，樂其俗。
passages.en: I would make the people return to the use of knotted cords (instead of the written characters). They should think their (coarse) food sweet; their (plain) clothes beautiful; their (poor) dwellings places of rest; and their common (simple) ways sources of enjoyment.

passages.zh: 鄰國相望，雞犬之聲相聞，民至老死，不相往來。
passages.en: There should be a neighbouring state within sight, and the voices of the fowls and dogs should be heard all the way from it to us, but I would make the people to old age, even to death, not have any intercourse with it.
